required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of eOD-GT8 60mer Vaccine, Adjuvanted
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Dosage Escalation Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of eOD-GT8 60mer Vaccine, Adjuvanted in HIV-uninfected, Healthy Adult Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1 first-in-human clinical trial to assess the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of eOD-GT8 60mer Vaccine, Adjuvanted, in up to 48 healthy adult HIV-negative volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase 1 first-in-human clinical trial to assess the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of eOD-GT8 60mer Vaccine, Adjuvanted, in up to 48 healthy adult HIV-negative volunteers. The study is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled dosage-escalation Phase 1 study intended to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of eOD-GT8 60mer Vaccine, Adjuvanted in a prime-boost regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability: frequency of local and systemic reactogenicity events
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of the study regimens based on the frequency of local and systemic reactogenicity events as assessed using the DAIDS Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events (v2.1).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability: proportion of volunteers with moderate or greater unsolicited adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of the study regimens based on the proportion of volunteers with moderate or greater unsolicited adverse events including safety laboratory as assessed using the DAIDS Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events (v2.1).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability: proportion of volunteers in each group with potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs)
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the proportion of volunteers in each group with potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) based on a defined list of pIMDs in the study protocol.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the frequency of eOD-GT8 60mer-specific, eOD-GT8 monomer-specific, and epitope-specific serum antibody responses after 1st and/or 2nd immunization compared to baseline and placebo
To evaluate the magnitude of eOD-GT8 60mer-specific, eOD-GT8 monomer-specific, and epitope-specific serum antibody responses after 1st and/or 2nd immunization compared to baseline and placebo

overall_official.affiliation: George Washington University School of Medicine & Health Sciences
